Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, cheap and centraly located”
Reviews.Author: Jordi_of_Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Possibly one of the best choices for budget travelers looking for a well-served and honest hotel at the very center of Istanbul. Two minutes walk to the tramway taking you to Ataturk Airport and five minuts walk to Santa Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Basic breakfast but good enough. Clean and well attended fom the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna_TK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Olimpiyat in May 2011. So, the brief description: very good location (5-15 minutes walk for the main attractions), friendly staff, clean (but small) rooms, good breakfast. But they don't have safe box in the room, and it was quite strange.

Reviews.Title: “Winter vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: omarbd
Reviews.Content: Great location. I have stayed with my family for 4 nights. Hotel gave us a nice cod for my 11 month old daughter without any request from us. Though the rooms are small but they are very clean and well maintained. The olive resturant run by the hotel has a excellent view with a very reasonable manu. Food was also great. We have a very memorable stay in istanbul, where Hotel Olimpiyat significantly contributed. We will definately come back to Olimpiyat.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: DJLMedeiros
Reviews.Content: Your room was a little bit small for 3 women but really clean and confortable! The breakfast was great! Is really well placed, just some minutes to de topkapi and santa Sofia, etc. And next to a street with many restaurants. The staff was great to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: 473travel222
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried before I arrived here thinking the rooms might be too small as there appears to be no space to move around in the pictures. But thankfully everything was fine. Room was very clean and exactly how it appears in the pictures. Was very pleased with the LCD TV (decent range of channels) and the shower was hot every morning with power. The housekeeping was excellent. We used to go out early morning to see the sights and by the time we came back our room would have been cleaned with fresh bed sheets.I have given this hotel a 5-rating as it met up to all it's expectations. Breakfast in the morning consisted of cheese slices, feta cheese, fresh watermelon and tomatoes, apples, cereals, tea, coffee, orange juice and hard bread rolls as well as a range of spreads. We really enjoyed staying here as it was a nice quiet hotel, had good sleep, and location was spot on as we could walk everywhere. There was a McDonald and burger king down the road as well as a large range of restaurants. So this was very convenient. But what made this experience even better was the staff. They were very helpful and polite, and always ready to help us. Also gave us a lot of advice on how to get to places. And on our first morning there we missed the breakfast slot but they still directed us to a table and offered us juice etc. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a nice base to stay in to explore the city and good customer service. It's part of the yasmak hotels, and opposite to this hotel there was a hotel called romance hotel (which had a yasmak sign). I'm assuming the romance hotel maintains the same standards, so worth a look! Also this hotel is a 5 minute walk from the sirkeci tram station which makes it convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “very cosy!”
Reviews.Author: alena12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Nothing bad to say - great service, great location, great stay :)

Reviews.Title: “The best choice of location,comfort and hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Rahim S
Reviews.Content: This year I stayed in this hotel two times: in April -with colleagues and in August of 2011 with family.First of all I have to underline the high professional level of hotel personnel,who create the very comfortable conditions for the visitors:the ideal cleanness of the rooms,tasteful breakfast,high attention to any wishes of the clients,low prices.Besides all described advantages,the location is ideally close to the old city centre.Surely I will stay in Olimpiat hotel next time also and reccomend it to all people who is going to visit Istanbul. Rahim Sultanov Baku.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Almireta
Reviews.Content: We got a triple room, with a queen size bed and an extra bed. Very clean room, no luxurious but just very comfortable for sleeping and resting. The breakfast was correct, they have a few tables and you have to wait a bit for getting a free table. The coffee and pastries were fine. The most imortant thing about this hotel is the location, it is just 5 minutes walking from Topkapy Palace, Haga Sofia...so, it is in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: minhee j
Reviews.Content: Location is very near by Gulhane tram station as well as Sultanahmet, Gulhane park, Topkapi palace etc. All of places are almost on foot with 10~15minutes. Mr.Sati Ummaz was one of staff at the hotel and he was really nice of us. Moreover, there was great breakfast and good service for guests. Even though the room size was small, the budget is basically very good and amenity was simple but perfect. We could also use hot water and minibar. Thanks for Mr.Sati!!:) We will choose this hotel when we wanna travel Istanbul again.:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: RonOro1982
Reviews.Content: . We spent 8 nights here on a recent trip to Istanbul. This being our first trip to this amazing city we were really pleased that the hotel was so well located. We quickly orientated ourselves and could walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in about ten minutes. Gulhane tram stop is so close and from here we could drop on the trams (reliable, cheap but sometimes quite crowded) and get over to other areas of the city to explore. Our room was an average side but neatly presented and the air conditioning was useful given the balmy evenings. The double glazed windows were great at blocking out any sound from the street. The morning breakfast was simple but filling and had enough choice to give a bit of variety. I had nice fresh break rolls, soft cheese and coffee but there was also yoghurt, fresh water melon slices, olives and eggs. Staff were friendly and the general atmosphere of the hotel was pleasant. Overall, a very nice hotel which I would recommend and certainly stay at again if I was back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osama1409
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is rather simple and exceptional but very near to Gulhane tram station, the staff was very friendly,I like the breakfast too much.. The rooms is good size and very good service from HK and all staff ,,, Thanks Erkan and Hussain and room service team jazakom Allah kheer .

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for a great location”
Reviews.Author: OneHappyTraveler45
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olympiat is one of the four Yasmek Hotels, all located in the heart of the old city within walking distance to all major attractions namely Aya Sofya, Blue mosque, Topkapi museum and the Grand Bazaar. It is also just few steps from a Tram station that can take you to these attractions and many other locations. The staff of the hotel were very helpful, accommodating and friendly. The hotel is just renovated so our room was very clean with modern fixtures and amenities. It was very comfortable. Even before we made any reservations, the manager was very helpful and allowed us access to the internet that we needed to take care of some business. When you come out of the hotel, the entire street has a party like atmosphere, full of restaurants with seating arrangements indoors as well as out doors on nicely decorated streets. People are very friendly and welcoming. The breakfast is complimentary and arranged in a semi buffet style on each table. This arrangement is more private but we would prefer a common area of catering that can be refilled generally and one would not feel the burden of getting refills on something you want that gets short.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us, but read the report”
Reviews.Author: GeoffAustralia
Reviews.Content: Good location but in a side street; might be an ok hotel for a single or couple (to use as a night-time sleeper) but we had our baby daughter and rooms too small , so we didn't stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, recommend anytime;”
Reviews.Author: Marcus0309
Reviews.Content: Ideal Hotel, well situated in the heart of the city and transport centres. We really enjoyed our stay and the efficient, personal hospitality of the staff. This hotel is clean, neat and modest, it catered for all our needs during our weeks stay in the city. Special thanks to Salis, the head waiter who gave personal attention to everyone at breakfast time,. The breakfast was more than adequate to send us on our way for the day. Compliments to the desk manager, Sati, as well, thank you for making our arrangements and getting us back to the airport in time. I will recommend your establishment when I am back in South Africa. Marcus Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, so-so rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Acolytec
Reviews.Content: Not recommended. Sourced through a travel agency - the good: great location, clean. The bad: they messed up both of my airport transfers, internet worked on only 1 of the 5 days of stay, only one receptionist spoke English and his attitude was relatively terrible - would totally ignore your presence and keep you waiting for at least 10 minutes until he finished whatever task he was working on completely before finally talking to you, no soap supplied in the shower (just shampoo for some reason). All and all, I recommend you look elsewhere - I don't ask for much in a budget hotel except friendly service, a clean room, and working internet

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RNM2409
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 03 nights only, but it was the best three nights. Hotel location is fantastic... walking distance to all the major sightseeing also walking distance to Grand Bazaar. Hotel is surrounded by many local restaurants & very easy to get around by. Rooms are compact but sufficient for 2 people only. Very clean. The receptionist always have a smile when you walk in no matter what time you come ... Staff very friendly & helpful with everything from a safety pin up to booking your tours at any time. Good breakfast.... it has all you need to start off in the morning... I would definately come back to Olimpiyat....

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: pcbdoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location--a bock from the Tram stop, walking distance to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar. You cannot beat the location. I went with a friend and my nephew. We had a triple room on the third floor. The room was small and sparse, and the bathroom tiny, but it was very clean.. The room was cleaned spotlessly daily, and towels were replaced daily. The breakfast was fine. The two gentlemen who worked there daily were very friendly to us and knew after the first day how we liked out coffee and who wanted juice. The front reception desk workers were friendly and the night workers were especially helpful. The hotel has free WiFI. The front desk will give you the PIN and password. There is also free WiFI in the park between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. There are many restaurants close by and a gret sports bar right across from the Tram stop. Many sporting events from all over the world are shown. Istanbul is one of the worlds great cities, and the Olimpiyat Hotel is in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie190735
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, we were on 3rd floor overlooking front street. The room a little small but clean, queen size bed with new pillows. Bathroom with corner shower and clean towels every day. So handy for all the sights and restaurants all around and definately within walking distance. We were lucky to find this hotel and the staff were very friendly, especially Sati Ummaz and others who helped us at Reception with bookings and advice about restaurants and sightseeing. There is a good Irish pub/hotel at the top of the road (left out of hotel, left again at top near main road) where we watched a couple of vital football matches on the screens and enjoyed the snacks and drinks. Atmosphere here was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: sarsurasci
Reviews.Content: We came to Hotel Olympiat after leaving another hotel in the area because the rooms were too small and cold! Hotel Olympiat's courteous staff showed us a spacious, warm room that we booked immediately. Our room had a view of the Hagia Sophia! It was walking distance to most of the major historical sites. The tram station was less than 2 blocks away, so that sites that were further away were easily accessible. The service in the hotel was excellent. The breakfast was adequate. Beds and rooms are clean and comfortable, but because of the central location, could be a bit noisy. Although not luxurious, it is a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, perfect location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Shaimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at olimpiyat hotel for a week after switching from a nearby hotel which didn't have any heat in the room! We got a bigger room (about twice the size) with a heater and an amazing view of the aya Sofia! At literally half the price!! So you can imagine our excitement to find this hotel. Would definately stay here again. The breakfast is also very fresh and delicious. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: Rashadm9
Reviews.Content: Olimpiyat Hotel represents itself as a good example of simplicity and comfort. Its purpose serves well budget places seekers. Its best strength is the prime location where you need the lowest efforts to reach many historical attractions in its surrounding area; starting south and uphill opposite to GÃ¼lhane Park gate where the 300 years old gigantic plane tree (TaÅŸlÄ± Ã‡Ä±nar of Fatih) stands alone. Also the Gulhane park a famous excursion area that basically used to be a private walking park for the Sultan of Topkapi Palace. Then, few steps uphill, Zeynep Sultan mosque, Caferaga Medresei CafÃ©, Topkapi Palace, Archeology Museum, Aya Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Binbirdirek Cistern, Sultan Ahmed Mosque, Islamic Arts Museum, Mosaic Museum, The Egyptian Hippodrome, Divan Street, Grand Bazaar, Sahaflar Market, Sanatlari Hand Craft Market and Arasta bazaar all are located in the area near by the hotel. You can also use the Gulhane Tram Station next to the hotel to wander the Panorama Museum and the Valens Aqueduct. Not to forget that the Open Bus tour starting red point of Sultanahmet is in this area too. Moreover, few steps to north and downhill you can wander the Misir Bazaar, Tahtakale Bazaar and the Yeni Mosque. You should also find all needed sea transport to Asian side, Adalar and the golden horn as well from Eminonu Station. I must add that nearby the hotel area number of famous restaurants and Turkish Hamams are found with short distance too. Iâ€™ve been a guest for 12 nights with my family of wife, two teens and 3 kids where Iâ€™ve experienced easy going stay, comfort rooms with nice views, reasonable fare and served by polite, helpful staff. I do miss the good days in Istanbul and the home sweet homeâ€¦Olimpiyatâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great location room small and not cleaned”
Reviews.Author: mondaymonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days, great location close to major tourist attractions. Room was a bit small for a twin room. Breakfast menu could do with a bit of variety, same thing every day for 9 days, tea and coffee lukewarm. Three star rating a bit generous, one or maybe two star at a push.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: stargatecmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in this hotel, Room 206 very small, view from window was another building 3 Feet away, Room was never Hovered the whole time we were there, Towes were changed but found blood stains on bed covers, Bed was very hard, no hot water before 7. building work going on next door all thought did stop before 6, Staff were very help full, but over all room very small got hot very quickly, AC cooled room ok and only 4 English TV channels 2 news and 2 film channel showing very old films , remember roots with chicken George, lots of German channels and some French, saw better rooms up higher but 206 to small

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, super location”
Reviews.Author: 7colinas
Reviews.Content: Super located 1min away walk from Gulhane tram stop. Check-in easy and fast, room 303. Reception staff not warm but professional, spoke english. Nice room, good pillow, closet, tv, phone, AC, private bathroom, desk and chair. No view on 3rd floor, only to front street which can be a bit noisy but windows are some kind of soundproof. Good breakfast with a mix of breads, simit, tomato, great goat cheese, olives, ham, cheese, butter, boiled eggs, jams, milk, coffee,orange juice and tea. Breakfast room only have capacity to less than 30 people at a time and only if you want to share a table next to other guests, it depends on hour and season. We always got a table with no one sitting next to us. Breakfast staff were nice. After breakfast we always ask to drink our tea (Ã§ay) on reception hall to make room and plan our day. Free-wifi on request, password needed, no charge.TV with english, german, italian and turkish channels. We were given some maps and tips on reception. Outside hotel you have lots of hotels and restaurants, itÂ´s impossible to walk without being invited to enter, prepare yourself, we had no problem cause we already went to Cairo and know the drill... and believe me, Istambul regarding this is a child comparing to Cairo :) Nevertheless outside is fine, we sit on some bar next to Olimpiyat, drink some raki on some big pillows they put on street and let it go... watching people going by and enjoyed the moment. Hotel Olimpiyat is 10min walking to Haya Sophia, 1min to Gulhane, 5min to Topkapi, 15min to Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. Some local laundries next to Hotel can be useful too. Eminonu is 10min walking and half way you can find some cheap kebabs, a supermarket and try the unforgettable fish sandwich next to Bosphoro. Tram can leave you to Ataturk Airport for less than 4 lyra in a 45min journey with only one connection easy signed. Nice value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Moder and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Needs11
Reviews.Content: I was staying at another hotel and they were overbooked so they moved me to the Olimpiyat Hotel. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. This was more me, I forgot to tell them I needed a non smoking hotel so I ended up in a smoking room which was hard at first but I left the widow open a few times so it aired out. Again this was my own fault for not remembering. The breakfast is great, the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is modern and clean and close to everything. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, modern hotel in the heart of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PeterR74
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable with modern rooms. Free wireless was available, just ask the concierge for the access code. We were traveling with a young child and our room came with a cot all setup in it on arrival. The rack rates were quite expensive but using an online booking service, we got a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rockyoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! very clean, nice staff, delicious breakfast, free wireless internet and perfect location I would definitely recommend to everyone! I had an amazing time in Istanbul. Take earplugs if you are going there - especially during the Ramadan (mosques wake up everyone at 5am).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Desiree1989
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, perfect location near the blue mosk and aya Sofia. Rooms are a bit small but very clean (everyday new towels etc.) The staff is friendly and the breakfast is fine! Price-quality is perfect! I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; some rooms more updated than others; free wi-fi; avoid printing at lobby coin-op computer”
Reviews.Author: bikinghiking123
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good choice for our first-ever visit to Istanbul. Centrally located between the sites in Sultanahmet (the mosques), Topkapi Palace, as well as Eminonu and the ferries. Also the tram stop is half a block away. Also, we were very wary about the many Istanbul hotels with reviews here that would have many posters with only one or two posts and only praising it, whereas this hotel has more reviews with varying experiences. We noticed that rooms that were not occupied would have their doors open for much of the day to air out. From the hallway I took a picture of a one queen or king bed room with a flat panel tv that was near ours...we wish we had this room! We are a couple-husband and wife. We heard that sometimes hotels will give you a hotel room with two beds instead of a shared bed if you are mixed-gender staying together, but I think it had more due to the fact that when booking via expedia there was no choice specifically, and it said 'double/twin' and we requested a one queen bed, but we ended up with a two twin bed hotel room. The shower showed some age, but worked well. The room was clean and always cleaned daily; towels were changed because the first day I noticed pen marks on one and the next day they were changed. Our experiences with the staff were nothing but fine. They were friendly during check-in, breakfast service, and housekeeping always greeted us whenever we passed each other by going in/out. Note: the free wi-fi worked great the entire time. We wanted to print our boarding passes however. So, we used the coin-op computer in the lobby. It needs 1 lira for each page, and 1 lira for each ten minutes use. It wouldn't print (we saw some other jobs in the print queue that obviously clogged the printer); the staff shut down the power and turned it back on and told us to put more coins in...but my husband explained it's not going to print at all and they refunded us the 4 lira we spent trying to get it to print--if it doesn't print once and you try to print again it only asks for more money. So, just check-in for your flight online and print your boarding passes at the airport which we did without any hassles! We opted for the free breakfast every morning and noticed many Turkish businessmen (they would sometimes converse with the staff) and a few tourists. It was never full in late May. The breakfast room seats 38 total with one table for two, and six tables seating six. The variety can be seen in the pics: feta cheese, sliced tomatoes, simit (pretzl bread), grain breads, plain breads, croissants, sliced cakes, sliced meat and cheese platter, olives, and choice of condiments (honey, apricot jam, nutella type spread, butter). We tend to eat the same type of breakfast at home, so we didn't mind the fact that the breakfast is the same daily. After all, it's complimentary, and there are plenty of people who'd love to have just a smidgen of their offering for nourishment. Expedia provided a $50 coupon off of our hotel reservation booking, and for the price we paid, we're quite happy with the hotel stay, even if we didn't have a nice queen bed room with a flat panel tv as we saw. We had a view of the terrace restaurant at the sister hotel Yasmak Hotel as well as of the Romance Hotel (another sister hotel), and could see the ferry and Bosphorus strait from one corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to see Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fairymay7
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul as for a short break. This hotel was in the best location to see the sights of the city. With most of the sights within walking distance. The continental breakfast was grand but after the 2nd day we stopped getting up for it because we could get nicer food when we were out and about. Our room was neat and compact. The ensuite had a brill shower in it wud wake u straight up!! Good selection of tv channels and free wifi which was great. The one downside was the staff. Some were nice however the guys behind the desk took it as a great insult if u asked them for anything.eg directions, suggestions on where to eat, etc. However dont let that discourage you because the other people in Istanbul will more then make up for a few unhappy receptionists!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near to the major sites. Staff could have been more friendly.”
Reviews.Author: GrahamGrape
Reviews.Content: Could not have chosen a more suitable hotel near to the sites. Breakfast was of a continental style. Bedroom adequate. I went with a friend, the only complaint we have is that the staff were a bit unfriendly to us.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel. Good location for the sights and tramway”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaBristol
Reviews.Content: I was put off this hotel when I walked to the desk to check in and the man at reception let my boyfriend and I stand there for ages whilst he ruffled paper without even an acknowledgement. None of the staff where particularly helpful or friendly. The rooms are clean and basic, pretty small but we only wanted to sleep there so it wasn't an issue. The breakfast room is really small and you have to sit 6 per table which means you can end up sitting between two couples you don't know. The food is spread out on the table and you have to share it. They do bring more but you have to wait. It wasn't a great breakfast with cold boiled eggs, bread and some feta and tomato. Really close to the Blue Mosque and walking distance to the Grand Bazaar but the nightlife is a bit of a non starter in this area. I would love to visit Istanbul again which is an amazing city. However I would not stay here. I'd be more inclinded to stay nearer Istiklal Street where in the evening thousands of Turks walk and in the backstreets there are hundreds of bars, restaurants, cafes and clubs. Around this hotel the nightlife is non existant and it's almost only tourists about in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Honest and reliable. For a budget in Istanbul the service is great.”
Reviews.Author: rizwanh72
Reviews.Content: Very honest and straight forward. They did not promise what they could not deliver. The rooms are a little small but very clean. Free reliable wifi for all guests in rooms. Would reccomend to anyone who wants a no nonsense experience. Other hotels of same price were much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay at hotel again very good”
Reviews.Author: ahmaj
Reviews.Content: Olimipiyat hotel is a very good and clean hotel. the staff were friendly and polite. The rooms were average size. The hotel is very close to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and the grand bazzar, about 5-10 min walk or you can go on the tram about 2 min, very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Ideally situated near most tourist spots.”
Reviews.Author: SonLed
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff. Excellent housekeeping. Breakfast was good, but needs to change menus. every other day at least. We stayed for 6 days and breakfast was the same since day 1. (boiled eggs, bread, tomatoes, olives , salami, cheese and cereals) juice and coffee. Receptionist by the name of Husein was very polite and helpful. Neighborhood is fantastic. The only comment I have as far as tourism is concerned is tour operators are charging tourist in Euro when Turkey is not even a meber of the European community.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ry_86_
Reviews.Content: Very nice placed, serviceminded hotel. The culture of turkish hospitality reflects at the hotel. Breakfast could be better, but were not the worst. I would recommend it to friends, and visit same hotel next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean friendly hotel perefect for short break sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: stevedog
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Olimpiyat. We wanted a hotel that was well positioned for sightseeing, clean and comfortable with a reasonable price tag. The Olimpiyat turned out to be just that. We walked to all the best sights, had a clean comfortable room with a clean modern bathroom. The room was serviced every morning and fresh towels provided daily. There was plenty of hot water whenever we wanted it. there was a fridge in the room which was very handy and a Tv with a couple fo English news channels . We wern't there to watch TV but it was nice to have on and listen to the news while getting ready to go out. The breakfast buffet was typical of this part of the world. Differnt breads and rolls, cereals, yogurt, cheeses, boiled eggs, fruit etc. It was all fresh and unlimited. The staff kept up a constant supply of coffee, tea and orange juice etc. We found the staff to be pleasant ,polite and helpful at all times. If you are looking for a break spent in a hotel with a spa. pool and top class luxury then it isn't the Olimpyat. Those hotels are available in Istanbul (we had a look at one) but at about 6 times want we paid for the Olimpiyat. If you are looking for a great base for sightseeing and a good standard at a reasonable price ,you should find the the Olimpiyat fits the bill. We certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, friendly and helpful reception service”
Reviews.Author: Asdak
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, within walking distance of all the major sites. As an OAP I could not have found more attentive staff in a 5 star hotel. I enjoyed my stay there so much and cannot rate it too highly.

Reviews.Title: “do not go there it is a youth hostel! very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: shingalanaWelt
Reviews.Content: it is not a hotel. it is a hostel. noisy and smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel at an affordable price, close to tram link and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: moliuman2004
Reviews.Content: It is just a brilliant hotel for the price. The hotel receptionist was very friendly, the location is within promixity to all the famous monuments/historic sites, it is only 20 yrds to the tram, you could almost walk to anywhere. There is also complimentary wireless internet and a pc at the lobby, so it is so convenient in terms of travelling and keeping in touch with the news/internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with perfect location and gr8 service !!!”
Reviews.Author: IMMZ
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the very first time with young kids (8 & 5). We stayed at OLIMPIYAT HOTEL for 7 nights in a triple room. MERVE YALLAGOZ (the sale representative of yasmak hotels ) guided us so well and booked this hotel for us as we wanted a cheaper place,otherwise they also have other two hotels Romance Hotel & Yasmak sultan (4 Star beautiful hotel) at the same location,but a bit more expensive than this one. Everything was well arranged starting with the pick-up service.The hotel is centrally located,near all the main attractions, (Ag. Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc) Also the tram station is right behind the hotel ,which we used all the time and was very convinient with kids.Breakfast was good and my children really enjoyed it.The rooms, though a bit small, very cosy and clean. Housekeeping was excellent. Homely atmosphere, and the staff was so friendly and helpful specially the manager MR.SATTEY.He made our stay very comfortable. I also want to mention the name of MR.ENGIN of YASMAK SULTAN as he also helped us so much and guided us so well , our trip wouldn't 've been so successful without him.THANX! We had a very good experience at Olimpiyat & I,m glad I made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: cascade25au
Reviews.Content: For a 3 Star hotel, this is one of the best that I have stayed in. We stayed there for 9 days and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Most things that we wanted to see was in walking distance. The tram station was 2 minutes away. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and the restaurant staff were outstanding. The only downside was that for the fist few nights the whole hotel was overheated. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ChrisInBelfast Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and, while this is a typical budget hotel in many respects, the staff were helpful and generally friendly and the location couldn't have been much better. There's a tram stop at the end of the street and the main sights (Hagia Sophia etc) are only a few minutes walk away. There are also plenty of good restaurants, cafes etc nearby. Our room didn't get any light from the window and we relied on air conditioning, but I would guess that's not unusual in the central part of the city. If you want a cheap, central, but basic hotel in Istanbul then I'd recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: harry_wet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff were fantastic, with really good English, they knew where to recommend too. The hotel was within a ten min walk from the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophya, the Bosporos and a second from the Tram, which gets you everywhere for 1,5 Lira. The breakfast was good and the neighbourhood was fantastic. Usual friendly Turkish hospitality. The rooms were clean, which is all you really need for a place to just sleep, wash and go out again. And as a girl traveling on my own I never once felt unsafe on my own here, night or day, unlike some parts of Istanbul I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will be back here again.”
Reviews.Author: AMixit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. It is very near the train station, and the port is just a short stroll away. There are a lot of restaurants around, and the main tourist attractions (such as the Blue Mosque) are literally just down the road â€“ the tram which takes you there goes right past the front door of the hotel. Breakfast was very generous. at our table for two there was a basket of bread, six boiled eggs, a plate of sliced tomatoes, plates of white (sheep's) cheese, salami, yellow (cow's) cheese, and a bowl of olives. There was also a plate of sweet rolls, croissants, pretzels and cake, together with chocolate spread, jams, honey, butter, and processed cheese. Tea and coffee is served at the table â€“ you can have milk, or drink it black, Turkish style, and you are also given a glass of orange juice, though surprisingly â€“ given the spread â€“ it wasn't fresh juice. Water is available if you prefer, as are various fruit and herb teas â€“ there is hot water/coffee machine. Just round the corner as you come in is a table with fresh fruit (apples and oranges) and a choice of cereals. The double room we had was compact but comfortable. It had a wardrobe (with a prayer mat for Muslims travelling light), a television, a chair and a stool, a desk with a big mirror and a light above it (I am told that these features are important to a certain segment of the population), and a fridge. It had a modern radiator with a temperature control, and there was also a modern air conditioning unit. We did find the room very warm even with the heating off, and there was building work going on in the street below, making it very noisy with the window open (it was double glazed, and kept the noise out very effectively when closed) so we ended up using the air con despite it being the middle of winter. There were accessible power points, a big window (easy to open) and a lot of lights, including an intriguing blue one above the wardrobe. The view was of the local street â€“ even on the fourth floor the buildings opposite rise above you. The en suite bathroom was very nice, sparkling clean and with an excellent shower, with lots of hot water, lots of towels, and soap dispensers instead of bars. The staff are polite and friendly â€“ ask for Sati Ummaz, whom we found to be very helpful. We asked for two extra pillows and they were sent up to us within a few minutes. There is an internet point in the lobby (L5/hour). It is possible to negotiate a reduced room rate if you stay for a few days, and the hotel will provide free transport to the airport (usual price L20 pp one way). However it proved even cheaper for us to book over the internet.

Reviews.Title: “best 3 star hotel we stayed in on our tour of Turkey”
Reviews.Author: crafts107
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in Nov 2009. It was the best 3 star hotel we stayed in on our tour of Turkey - very clean and comfortable room with fast wireless connection and good breakfast. We found it ideal for visiting Topkapi Palace, and Blue Mosque and Aghia Sophia. We don't like walking much and a few minutes brought us to these sites, and also to the boat for the interesting tour of Bosphorus so the setting was ideal. At the end of the week we had a hire car delivered to our hotel and found it easy to negotiate the exit from Istanbul to Gallipoli which was our next stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good rooms, no shortage of towels!”
Reviews.Author: DrVegaPunk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the same company as Hotel Romance and it shows. They have good service and ice on demand and don't run out of towels! A fair price and good location, easy walk to Aya Sofia, Sultan Hamet and tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: petrova032
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights. My room was ok. The staff was very accommodating and did everything in their power to make my stay enjoyable. The hotel was located where close to all historical places such as blue mosque and grand bazaar. And the tram station is also close by. This is not a fancy or luxurious place, but is for travelers who want a basic, clean hotel with local flavor at a reasonable price. I had a great time there and I would go back anytime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajhemworld
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 nights, hotel was OK , but they didnt know English at all. Rooms were clean but very very small, breakfast was included and not great but atleast a basic breakfast. But good location near Sultanahmet & 2 minutes walk from the tram station sirkecy

Reviews.Title: “the location is excellent and the hotel is value for money”
Reviews.Author: hans73
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul with my wife and 2 year old kid. The main usp of the hotel is its location, all the touristy spots like the Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Galata Bridge are within close walking distance. There are ppllleentyyy of eating joints close by as well. The room are small though, our room just had enough space for the 3 beds, not much space to keep stuff. But its clean and we had no problem with the toilets and bathroom. Of course we just used the hotel to sleep and nothing else. If you want to spend long hours in the hotel then its not the place for you. Breakfast is decent, not a wide spread but breads, cheese and some salami. Again it suited us well but people looking out for a huge spread will be disappointed. Staff are reasonably friendly. Never ate any meals in the hotel so wouldnt know how good it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissHolidayFan
Reviews.Content: Location is great to walk to main attractions from, and only meters from a tram stop. The rooms were clean and had a good shower. The beds were small, but needed to be to fit in the tiny room. They provided a cot for my 5 year old and expected her to sleep in it! However they did change it. Breakfast was OK. Nothing special but sufficiant. It is very basic and OK if you just want a base. But there is not even a hint of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location,clean and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: cityfreak_9
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed here for 4 nights and had a fabulous time in this beautiful city. Location perfect - 10 min walk to Bosphorous, 5 mins to Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia,15 mins to Grand Bazaar. Tram stop just around the corner. Rooms and bathrooms small and basic but beautifully clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Cold breakfast of meats, cheese, breads, eggs, preserves etc layed out on your own tables and help yourself to cereal and fruit on the side. Coffee, tea and juice - as much as you want.. Fitness centre and restaurant available over the road in sister building.

Reviews.Title: “Six Days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MancUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay in this great city. The location of this little boutique style hotel is just superb. Situated in what seems to be the hotel heartland of the SultanAhmet area , you're within a comfortable ( slightly hilly ) ten minute walk from the major sites ( eg, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern etc ). To get to the Gulhane tram Stop just turn left as soon as you step out of the hotel, walk to the end of the street, turn left again and walk to the bottom of this street and the tram stop is right there - only minutes from your hotel front door. Nearby, there are also plenty of restaurants, grocery stores , two small mini-markets & a pharmacy further up the road. Breakfast consists of boiled eggs, bread ( regular & sweet ), cheeses, olives, a cold meat, three cereals, orange juice , tea & coffee everyday. So, it is understandable that it becomes repetitive and samey after a few days. We booked taxi transport from the hotel to Eyup Sultan Mosque - which cost about YTL 15 each way from reception . For Muslims visiting, the rooms have a prayer mat and prayer beads in the wardrobe & the direction the Qibla marked with a sticker on the window ledge. Prayer times can be obtained from the front desk. The rooms are a little on the small-side but if you're looking for a hotel to use just as a base and keep your costs down, i'd thoroughly recommend the "Olimpiyat".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hellequin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the Blue Mosque, Ayia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The rooms are small but very well appointed and you aren't going to be spending much time in them anyway. They are cleaned every day and the staff are efficient and friendly. Breakfast is a typical continental affair, quite enough to give you a good start to the day. The hotel is located about 50 meters from the Gulhane tram stop, very handy for trips to and from the airport. A very enjoyable stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie_London1
Reviews.Content: Basic breakfast, very small room and bathroom. Excellent location for all the famous sights and very near tram stop. Everything within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: everon46
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Olimpiyat hotel 4 nights in total, a party of eight adults, we found the hotel to be in the perfect location for all the main sights of Istanbul, clean, friendly staff, good breakfast, on the minus side the rooms are rather small but ok for a short stay. We were let down on arrival at the airport, where they were to meet us on arrival and transfer us free to the hotel, no show, no phone call from them to explain why, we booked the hotel in February leaving our contact no in case of problems, after three calls from us they told us to get a taxi, on arrival at the hotel they did offer free return transfer back to the airport on return. Also at the time of booking their website offered a package for 3 nights stay or more, including fruit and wine in room on arrival, 1 free dinner at the olive restaurant, and a free tour, they even gave me a ref. number for this. On arrival, they denied the offer existed, then the manager told us we must pay 100 euros per room per night to get this offer, very confusing website, 8 of us, plus two other couples we met, were also confused by this. We feel unfairly treated, the manager could at least have offered a complimentary meal, or a bottle of wine but he wasn't interested. So if you want to stay at this hotel, go ahead, but do not expect any free offers and do not be surprised if your taxi is not at the airport to meet you !

Reviews.Title: “Quite a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kian_Essex
Reviews.Content: First trip to Turkey & we stayed at the Olimpiyat Hotel for 7 nights. The hotel is nicely located between the golden horn & SultanAhmet. 10 mins walk to major sites like blue mosque, St Sofia, Tokapi Palace, spice bazaar, Sikeci station. Grand bazaar about 20 mins away. A lot of lovely eating places around, too many! One has to try their meat balls and grilled fishes, mouth-watering. Most hotel staff are courteus and friendly. Room tiny but newly renovated. I am happy to give 4 out of 5 for Olimpiyat Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: cazza50
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location for all main sightseeing attractions. Our room was a double room but was tiny. the bed was pushed up against the wall and there was only about a 3 feet gap around the bed . We were only there for 2 nights so could put up with it but it would have been unbearable to stay longer. The room was very clean ond modern and the bathroom was immaculate. just a shame our room was the size of a matchbox!

HotelInfo.Name: Olimpiyat Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ebusuud Cad Erdogan Sok No 6, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
